tool.name: IDRipper
tool.description: Split protein/peptide identification file into several files according to annotated file origin.
tool.command:
IDRipper
#if $param_in: -in $param_in #end if #if $param_out: -out $param_out #end if #if $param_out_path: -out_path "$param_out_path" #end if #if $param_threads: -threads $param_threads #end if #if $adv_opts.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts.param_version: -version "$adv_opts.param_version" #end if #if $adv_opts.param_log: -log "$adv_opts.param_log" #end if #if $adv_opts.param_debug: -debug $adv_opts.param_debug #end if #if $adv_opts.param_no_progress: -no_progress #end if #if $adv_opts.param_force: -force #end if #if $adv_opts.param_test: -test #end if #end if

param.name: param_in
param.label: Input file, in which the protein/peptide identifications must be tagged with 'file_origin'

param.name: param_out_path
param.label: Directory for the output files after ripping according to 'file_origin'

param.name: param_threads
param.label: Sets the number of threads allowed to be used by the TOPP tool

param.name: param_version
param.label: Version of the tool that generated this parameters file

param.name: param_log
param.label: Name of log file (created only when specified)

param.name: param_no_progress
param.label: Disables progress logging to command line

param.name: param_test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

tool.help:
Split protein/peptide identification file into several files according to annotated file origin.
For more information, visit http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/TOPP_IDRipper.html
